qas.question: What type of forum was the subject of a January 2009 front page story in The Sun?
Who was said to be targeted in The Sun's front page story?

answers.text: a "hate hit list" of British Jews

qas.question: What magazine refuted the claims made by The Sun in its article about the forum?
According to Private Eye who was the only forum member expressing wishes for a hate campaign?
Complaints to which body led to The Sun removing the story from its website?

context: On 7 January 2009, The Sun ran an exclusive front page story claiming that participants in a discussion on Ummah.com, <a0_0>a British Muslim internet forum<a0_0/>, had made <a1_0>a "hate hit list" of British Jews<a1_0/> to be targeted by extremists over the Gaza War. It was claimed that "Those listed [on the forum] should treat it very seriously. Expect a hate campaign and intimidation by 20 or 30 thugs." The UK magazine <a2_0>Private Eye<a2_0/> claimed that <a3_0>Glen Jenvey<a3_0/>, a man quoted by The Sun as a terrorism expert, who had been posting to the forum under the pseudonym "Abuislam", was the only forum member promoting a hate campaign while other members promoted peaceful advocacy, such as writing 'polite letters'. The story has since been removed from The Sun's website following complaints to the <a4_0>UK's Press Complaints Commission<a4_0/>.
